intro: Carlina ixia, commonly known as the African marguerite, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow flowers surrounded by white ray florets, giving it a daisy-like appearance. Carlina ixia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has a hairy stem and leaves that are typically gray-green in color.
